Note: The user / PT mentioned that they would have preferred the hand gesture for swiping to be an index finger swipe as opposed to rubbing the thumb against the index finger.

Capturing & sharing media files was successful. The user / PT however was not able to identify when meta attempted to get a confirmation before sending media files . For eg . After they asked meta to send a photo , meta would say .” Send to ….. ? “ but then the user / PT kept silent and thought it was an error.
After successfully sending a few media files via WhatsApp, subsequent files were not sent and had to be imported in the meta app first.

The user / PT said couldn’t tell that a video was still recording , the would have preferred to be able to see on their end that the video was actually being recorded. They also would have preferred to say just “ meta” each time instead of “hey meta” .

The user / PT observed a glitch in the display in terms of the pictures / information displayed when meta is asked a question. Some screens appeared blank , some would begin a display and then it closes out in the middle of that.
User / PT mentioned that a point , they volume control display was automatically toggling even though they didn’t make any gestures for that.
While listening to music + messaging in WhatsApp , meta app froze at a point while the user / PT was responding to a message. After disconnected & reconnecting WhatsApp, it started to work well.
I noticed that the user / PT would occasionally adjust the glasses as it was sliding down their nose bridge. She was comfortable with the fit of the glasses though.

While trying to send a reply via WhatsApp using  meta , the response was cancelled accidentally a few times when the user / PT was just “moving “ their fingers - the intention was not to cancel the message l they felt a bit frustrated that they had to repeat the message multiple times. The user / PT also mentioned that they would have loved to be able to send emojis etc .
